name: Paris, France
short: The city of love, art, and fashion.

details.history: Paris has been a center of art, culture, and politics since the Roman era, famously home to the French Revolution.
details.culture: Known for its haute couture, fine dining, and café culture.
details.bestTime: April to June and September to November.

name: London, United Kingdom
short: A historic hub of culture and modern life.

details.history: London grew from a Roman settlement and became the heart of the British Empire.
details.culture: A mix of royal traditions and modern multiculturalism.
details.bestTime: March to May and September to October.

name: Rome, Italy
short: The Eternal City with ancient ruins and piazzas.

details.history: Rome was the capital of the Roman Empire and remains rich with archaeological heritage.
details.culture: Known for art, architecture, and Italian cuisine.
details.bestTime: April to June and late September to October.

name: Venice, Italy
short: Romantic canals and gondola rides.

details.history: Built on over 100 islands, Venice was a major maritime power during the Middle Ages.
details.culture: Famous for opera, glassmaking, and Venetian masks.
details.bestTime: April to May and September to November.

name: Barcelona, Spain
short: Modernist architecture and Mediterranean vibes.

details.history: Barcelona was founded as a Roman city and grew into Catalonia’s vibrant capital.
details.culture: Celebrated for Gaudí’s architecture and Catalan traditions.
details.bestTime: May to June and September to October.

name: Madrid, Spain
short: A lively city with art, parks, and tapas.

details.history: Madrid became Spain’s capital in the 16th century under King Philip II.
details.culture: Known for its nightlife, tapas, and flamenco music.
details.bestTime: March to May and September to November.

name: Athens, Greece
short: Birthplace of democracy and the Acropolis.

details.history: Athens was the heart of Ancient Greece, a powerful civilization and empire.
details.culture: Rich in mythology, philosophy, and Mediterranean cuisine.
details.bestTime: March to May and September to November.

name: Santorini, Greece
short: Famous white houses and stunning sunsets.

details.history: Santorini was formed by a volcanic eruption, creating its dramatic cliffs.
details.culture: Iconic Cycladic architecture and wine-making traditions.
details.bestTime: April to May and September to October.

name: Istanbul, Turkey
short: Where East meets West with rich history.

details.history: Istanbul, formerly Byzantium and Constantinople, was capital of the Byzantine and Ottoman Empires.
details.culture: A fusion of European and Asian influences.
details.bestTime: April to May and September to November.

name: Cappadocia, Turkey
short: Hot air balloons over fairy chimneys.

details.history: Cappadocia is famous for its unique rock formations and ancient cave dwellings.
details.culture: Known for carpet weaving, pottery, and Turkish hospitality.
details.bestTime: April to June and September to October.

name: Cairo, Egypt
short: Land of pyramids and the Nile River.

details.history: One of the oldest continuously inhabited cities; gateway to ancient Egyptian civilization and the Giza pyramids.
details.culture: Strong Arabic traditions, bustling bazaars, Nile culture and Coptic heritage.

name: Luxor, Egypt
short: Ancient temples and Valley of the Kings.

details.history: Luxor stands on the site of ancient Thebes, with enormous temples and royal tombs.
details.culture: Strong pharaonic heritage, archaeological tourism and traditional Nubian influences.

name: Marrakech, Morocco
short: Bustling souks and colorful medinas.

details.history: Founded in the 11th century; historically a trade crossroads connecting sub-Saharan Africa and Europe.
details.culture: Arabic, Berber and Islamic traditions; famous for souks, riads and craftsmanship.

name: Cape Town, South Africa
short: Table Mountain and beautiful coastlines.

details.history: A key port city with Dutch and British colonial history and a rich indigenous heritage.
details.culture: Multicultural city with strong outdoor culture, vineyards and a vibrant arts scene.

name: Dubai, UAE
short: Luxury skyscrapers and desert adventures.

details.history: Small fishing and pearl villages transformed into a global city after oil discovery; rapid modern development.
details.culture: Blend of Emirati traditions with global expatriate influences; luxury retail and modern architecture.

name: Abu Dhabi, UAE
short: Cultural landmarks and stunning mosques.

details.history: Capital of the UAE and center of politics and culture with rapid development after oil wealth.
details.culture: Emirati heritage, museums, and modern urban planning.

name: Petra, Jordan
short: Rose-red city carved into rock.

details.history: Ancient Nabatean capital carved into sandstone cliffs; important caravan city on trade routes.
details.culture: Bedouin traditions, Jordanian hospitality and archaeological tourism.
details.population: Petra region small; nearest city (Wadi Musa) ≈25k

name: Bali, Indonesia
short: Tropical paradise with beaches and temples.

details.history: Balinese Hindu culture developed over centuries with strong traditions distinct from much of Indonesia.
details.culture: Hindu festivals, temple architecture, traditional dance, surf culture and wellness tourism.

name: Jakarta, Indonesia
short: A lively capital full of culture and markets.

details.history: Capital of Indonesia, a melting pot shaped by maritime trade, colonial history and post-independence development.
details.culture: Diverse languages and cuisines from across Indonesia; bustling urban life.

name: Singapore
short: A futuristic city with green spaces.

details.history: A strategic port city that modernized rapidly after independence in 1965 into a global financial hub.
details.culture: Multicultural (Chinese, Malay, Indian), strong urban planning and strict civic rules.
details.bestTime: Year-round (equatorial climate) — drier months Feb–Apr marginally better

name: Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
short: Petronas Towers and diverse food culture.

details.history: Founded as a tin-mining town and grew into Malaysia's modern capital blending Malay, Chinese and Indian influences.
details.culture: Diverse ethnic mix, religious festivals, street food culture.

name: Bangkok, Thailand
short: Bustling markets and vibrant temples.

details.history: Capital of Thailand since the late 18th century and a major regional trading and cultural center.
details.culture: Thai temples, street food culture, lively markets and royal traditions.

name: Chiang Mai, Thailand
short: Cultural heart of northern Thailand.

details.history: Former capital of the Lanna Kingdom with centuries-old temples and mountain culture.
details.culture: Lanna traditions, night markets, temple festivals and handicrafts.

name: Tokyo, Japan
short: A mix of ultramodern and traditional culture.

details.history: Formerly Edo, Tokyo became Japan's political center in the 17th century and grew into a global megacity.
details.culture: Blend of ancient shrines and cutting-edge tech/pop culture, world-class cuisine and fashion.

name: Kyoto, Japan
short: Ancient temples and peaceful gardens.

details.history: Japan's imperial capital for over a thousand years, preserving traditional architecture, temples and gardens.
details.culture: Geisha districts, tea ceremonies, Zen gardens and seasonal festivals.

name: Seoul, South Korea
short: Trendy districts and royal palaces.

details.history: Capital of several Korean dynasties and modern center for technology, pop culture (K-pop) and commerce.
details.culture: Vibrant pop culture, palace heritage, nightlife and street food.

name: Hong Kong
short: A vibrant city with skyline and harbor.

details.history: A former British colony and major trading port; today a global financial center with a unique East-meets-West culture.
details.culture: Cantonese cuisine, bustling markets, cinematic legacy and dense skyline.

name: Sydney, Australia
short: Opera House and stunning harbor views.

details.history: Founded as a British penal colony, grew into a multicultural metropolis and Australia’s iconic harbour city.
details.culture: Beach lifestyle, outdoor cafes, strong arts scene and multicultural food.

name: Melbourne, Australia
short: Cultural capital with coffee and arts.

details.history: Grew rapidly during the Victorian gold rush and is now known for arts, sport and coffee culture.
details.culture: Cafés, street art, live music and major sporting events.

name: New York City, USA
short: The city that never sleeps.

details.history: A major colonial port evolved into the economic and cultural capital of the United States.
details.culture: Theatre (Broadway), diverse neighborhoods, museums and 24/7 city life.

name: Los Angeles, USA
short: Hollywood, beaches, and sunshine.

details.history: From Spanish mission and ranching outpost to global center for film and entertainment.
details.culture: Film and music industries, beach culture, and major car-centric urban sprawl.
details.bestTime: Year-round (mild Mediterranean climate), best spring & fall

name: Miami, USA
short: Tropical vibes and Art Deco style.

details.history: Grew in the 20th century as a tourist destination; strong Latin American and Caribbean influences.
details.culture: Beaches, nightlife, Latin music, and Art Deco heritage in South Beach.

name: San Francisco, USA
short: Golden Gate Bridge and hilly streets.

details.history: Boomed during the Gold Rush and later developed into a tech and cultural center.
details.culture: Progressive, tech-influenced, with strong food and arts scenes.

name: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
short: Beaches, Carnival, and Christ the Redeemer.

details.history: Famous colonial port and former capital, known for its dramatic landscape and Carnival tradition.
details.culture: Samba, Carnival festivals, beach culture and Afro-Brazilian influences.

name: Cancún, Mexico
short: Turquoise waters and Mayan ruins.

details.history: Developed as a tourist resort in the 1970s on the Yucatán Peninsula with nearby Mayan archaeological sites.
details.culture: Resort tourism, Mayan heritage nearby and coastal seafood traditions.

name: Havana, Cuba
short: Colorful streets and classic cars.

details.history: Founded by the Spanish, Havana retains colonial architecture, revolutionary history and strong Afro-Caribbean culture.
details.culture: Music (son, salsa), classic cars, colonial plazas and lively street life.
details.currency: Cuban Peso (CUP) / Convertible Peso (historically used by tourists; check current local regulations)

name: Reykjavík, Iceland
short: Northern lights and geothermal wonders.

details.history: Settled by Vikings in the 9th century, now Iceland’s capital.
details.culture: Nordic heritage, music, geothermal living.

name: Siem Reap, Cambodia
short: Gateway to Angkor Wat temples.

details.history: Once the capital of the Khmer Empire, famed for Angkor Wat.
details.culture: Buddhist traditions, Khmer architecture.

name: Queenstown, New Zealand
short: Adventure capital of the world.

details.history: Gold rush town turned adventure hub.
details.culture: Kiwi outdoor lifestyle, Maori traditions nearby.

name: Zanzibar, Tanzania
short: Spice islands with pristine beaches.

details.history: Trading hub for spices, part of Sultanate of Oman.
details.culture: Swahili culture, spice tours, dhow sailing.

name: Paro, Bhutan
short: Himalayan monasteries and dramatic landscapes.

details.history: Historic town home to Paro Dzong fortress and Rinpung Dzong monastery.
details.culture: Buddhist heritage, festivals, Himalayan traditions.

name: Galápagos Islands, Ecuador
short: Unique wildlife and volcanic landscapes.

details.history: Volcanic islands studied by Darwin for evolution.
details.culture: Eco-tourism, marine conservation.

name: Chamonix, France
short: Alpine skiing and Mont Blanc views.

details.history: Famous mountain town and first Winter Olympics host.
details.culture: Alpine sports, French mountain cuisine, mountaineering.

name: Svalbard, Norway
short: Arctic wilderness with polar bears.

details.history: Remote Arctic archipelago, historically a whaling and mining area.
details.culture: Scientific research, Arctic expeditions, small international community.

name: Madagascar
short: Island of unique wildlife and baobabs.

details.history: Fourth largest island in the world, with unique biodiversity.
details.culture: Malagasy traditions, music, and dance.

name: Thimphu, Bhutan
short: Peaceful Himalayan capital with rich Buddhist culture.

details.history: Capital city with dzongs, monasteries, and Bhutanese architecture.
details.culture: Buddhist festivals, traditional dress, local crafts.

name: Komodo Island, Indonesia
short: Home of the famous Komodo dragons.

details.history: Part of the Lesser Sunda Islands, UNESCO World Heritage site.
details.culture: Local island communities, eco-tourism, diving culture.

name: Patagonia, Chile & Argentina
short: Dramatic mountains, glaciers, and wild landscapes.

details.history: Remote region spanning southern Chile and Argentina, explored in 19th century expeditions.
details.culture: Ranching, gaucho traditions, adventure tourism.

name: Faroe Islands
short: North Atlantic cliffs and remote Viking charm.

details.history: North Atlantic archipelago under Danish sovereignty.
details.culture: Viking heritage, sheep farming, folk music.

name: Sri Lanka
short: Tropical island with ancient cities and tea plantations.

details.history: Ancient civilizations dating back over 2,000 years.
details.culture: Buddhist temples, colonial heritage, tea culture.

name: Namibia
short: Deserts, dunes, and wildlife safaris.

details.history: Former German colony, independent since 1990.
details.culture: Indigenous communities, wildlife tourism, desert lifestyle.

name: Moorea, French Polynesia
short: Lagoon paradise with mountain backdrops.

details.history: Island near Tahiti, famous for Polynesian culture.
details.culture: Traditional Polynesian dance, music, and weaving.

name: Namhae, South Korea
short: Coastal beauty with traditional Korean villages.

details.history: Southern island known for terraced farms and scenic coastlines.
details.culture: Korean farming traditions, seafood cuisine.

name: Tahiti, French Polynesia
short: Volcanic island with black sand beaches.

details.history: Largest island in French Polynesia, famous for culture and natural beauty.
details.culture: Polynesian dance, music, tattoo traditions.

name: Palau
short: Pristine island nation with marine biodiversity.

details.history: Pacific island nation with WWII history and marine conservation.
details.culture: Micronesian traditions, diving culture.
